title: Thinking It Through - use of examples

content.question: In paragraph 1, sentence 6 (“But real … atomic reactors”), the author uses examples of people whom computers “advise” primarily to

choices.label: illustrate the growing range of professions in which intelligent machines are replacing human beings
provide evidence of the degree to which real computers contribute to intellectually complicated tasks
establish the social relevance of his attempts to understand the nature of computer intelligence
distinguish the tasks performed by computers in movies from those they perform in real life

content.answer: provide evidence of the degree to which real computers contribute to intellectually complicated tasks

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and explain claims and evidence within an argument.
